column4: I cannot seem to mount an ISO image I have... "dmesg | tail" returns "Unable to identify CD-ROM format."   It's the third disc in a game (Mafia) and the other two mounted fine.
It's worth mentioning that the other two ISO images are under 700MB but this one is 770MB
Does that have anything to do with it?  Any suggestions?
Perhaps an application that scans ISO files to see if there's something wrong with the iso9660 filesystem?
Erm, you mean from the data DVD I burned?
what does file say the image file is?
mount -o loop -t iso9660 Mafia3.iso /mnt/iso/
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/loop1,
missing codepage or other error
sounds corrupt - if file doesn't say 'ISO 9660 CD-ROM filesystem data', that's probably it
eep
isoinfo -i Mafia\ -\ Disc\ 3.iso
CD-ROM is NOT in ISO 9660 format
Umm, so what do I do here?  Is this just a *bad* image file?
looks like - what does file say about it? just 'data'? ;)
yes
not a good sign
Ugh, I made this image with Alcohol 120% I'm pretty sure
I'm almost certain it worked under Windows...
But it's obviously not a valid ISO9660 filesystem... so how do I tell what it is?  I mean I'm fairly certain it *is* a working image file.
'almost certain' huh? ;)
It's 770MB btw, whereas the first two discs of the game are under 700MB
Hehe, yeah I should check first, but I really don't want to boot up into Windows
file is pretty good at identifying things; if it says 'data' it's nothing overly standard or well-known
